short_text: It is derived from the word wan-nazi`at with which the Surah opens.
text:
It is derived from the word wan-nazi\`at with which the Surah opens.

Period of Revelation

According to Hadrat Abdullah bin Abbas, this Surah was sent down after Surah An-Naba. Its subject matter also testifies that it belongs to the earliest period at Makkah.

Theme and Subject Matter

Its theme is affirmation of Resurrection and the life hereafter; It also warns of the consequences of belying the Messenger of God.

The Surah opens with oaths sworn by the angels who take the soul at deaths and those who hasten to carryout Allah's Commands, and those who conduct the affairs of the universe according to Divine Will, to assure that the Resurrection will certainly come to pass and the second life after death will certainly take place. For the angels who are employed to pluck out the soul today can also be employed to restore the soul tomorrow, and the angels who promptly execute Allah's Commands and conduct the affairs of the universe today can also upset the order of the universe tomorrow by orders of the same God and can also bring about a new order.

After this the people have been told, so as to say: "This work which you regard as absolutely impossible, is not any difficult for Allah, for which He may have to make lengthy preparations. Just a single jolt will upset this system of the world and a second jolt will be enough to cause you to appear as living beings in the new world. At that time the same people who were wont to deny it, would be trembling with fear and seeing with awe struck eyes all that they thought was impossible.

Then, relating the story of the Prophet Moses and Pharaoh briefly, the people have been warned to the effect: "You know full well what fate the Pharaoh met in consequence of belying the Messenger and rejecting the guidance brought by him and endeavoring to defeat his mission by trickery and deceit. If you do not learn any lesson from it and do not change your ways and attitude accordingly, you also will have to meet the same fate.

Then, in vv. 27-33, arguments have been given for the Hereafter and life after death. In this regard, the deniers have been asked the question:"Is your resurrection a more difficult task or the creation of the huge Universe which spreads around you to infinite distances with myriads of its stars and planets? Your recreation cannot be difficult for the God for Whom this was an easy task. Thus, after presenting in a single sentence, a decisive argument for the possibility of the Hereafter, attention has been drawn to the earth and its provisions that have been arranged in it for the sustenance of man and animal and of which everything testifies that it has been created with great wisdom for fulfilling some special purpose. Pointing to this the question has been left for the intellect of man to ponder for itself and form the opinion whether calling man to account after having delegated authority and responsibilities to a creature like him in this wise system would be more in
keeping with the demands of wisdom, or that he should die after committing all sorts of misdeeds in the world and should perish and mix in the dust for ever and should never be called to account as to how he employed the authority and fulfilled the responsibilities entrusted to him. Instead of discussing this question, in vv. 34-41, it has been said: "When the Hereafter is established, men's eternal future will be determined on the criterion as to which of them rebelled against his God transgressing the bounds of service and made the material benefits and pleasures his objective of life and which of them feared standing before his Lord and refrained from fulfilling the unlawful desires of the self." This by itself provides the right answer to the above question to every such person who considers it honestly, free from stubbornness. For the only rational, logical and moral demand of giving authority and entrusting responsibilities to man in the world is that he should be called to
account on this very basis ultimately and rewarded or punished accordingly.

In conclusion, the question of the disbelievers of Makkah as to when Resurrection will take place, has been answered. They asked the Holy Prophet this question over and over again. In reply it has been said that the knowledge of the time of its occurrence rests with Allah alone. The Messenger is there only to give the warning that it will certainly come. Now whoever wishes may mend his ways, fearing its coming, and whoever wishes may behave and conduct himself as he likes, fearless of its coming. When the appointed time comes, those very people who loved the life of this world and regarded its pleasures as the only object of life, would feel that they had stayed in the world only for an hour or so. Then they will realize how utterly they had ruined their future for ever for the sake of the short lived pleasures of the world.
description: The surah that opens with the oath of the Divine One swearing by The Wresters, the angelic pullers, who shall harshly wrest out the souls of the unbelievers at their appointed time of death. It takes its name from “the wresters” (al-nāziʿāt) mentioned in verse 1. The main theme of the surah is the possibility and inevitability of the Resurrection, its results, and its timing. The story of Moses and Pharaoh acts as encouragement to the Prophet and a warning to the disbelievers.The surah is also known as: (Soul-)Snatchers, Extractors, The Angelic Pullers, The Forceful Chargers, The Pluckers, The Soul-Snatchers, Those That Rise, Those Who Pull and Withdraw, Those Who Tear Out.

Efendi Nahi.verse 79:1: Betohem në ata (engjëj) që i marrin shpirtërat ashpër (jombesimtarëve)
Efendi Nahi.verse 79:2: dhe në ata që i marrin butësisht (besimtarëve)
Efendi Nahi.verse 79:3: dhe në ata (engjëj) që notojnë në hapësirë (në mes Tokës e qiellit),
Efendi Nahi.verse 79:4: si dhe në ata (engjëj) që garojnë (për kryerjen e urdhërave),
Efendi Nahi.verse 79:5: dhe betohem në ata (engjëj) që i rregullojnë ato që nuk janë të rregulluara,
Efendi Nahi.verse 79:6: në Ditën kur Toka do të dridhet nga tërmeti,
Efendi Nahi.verse 79:8: Atë ditë, zemrat do të jenë të tronditura,
Efendi Nahi.verse 79:9: e shikimet e tyre të përulura.
Efendi Nahi.verse 79:10: Ata (jobesimtarët) thonë: “A, me të vërtetë, do të kthehemi ne – në jetë (në gjendjen e mëparshme)?
Efendi Nahi.verse 79:11: A thua edhe kur të bëhemi eshtra të kalbur?”
Efendi Nahi.verse 79:12: E thonë: “E atëherë (të kthyerit), do të jemi të humbur.
Efendi Nahi.verse 79:13: E do të jetë ajo (ringjallja) vetëm një thirrje,
Efendi Nahi.verse 79:14: dhe, ja ata përnjëherësh (të gjallë) në Tokë.
Efendi Nahi.verse 79:15: A të ka ardhur ty (o Muhammed) lajmi për Musain,
Efendi Nahi.verse 79:16: kur Zoti i tij e ka thirrë atë në luginën e shenjtë të Tuvasë:
Efendi Nahi.verse 79:17: “Shko te Faraoni, se ai, me të vërtetë, është tërbuar,
Efendi Nahi.verse 79:18: dhe thuaj (Faraonit): ‘A don ti të pastrohesh (nga të këqiat),
Efendi Nahi.verse 79:19: dhe të udhëzoj te Zoti yt, që t’i druhesh (për të mos bërë të këqia)?
Efendi Nahi.verse 79:20: Dhe, ia tregoi (Musai-Faraonit) mrekullinë më të madhe,
Efendi Nahi.verse 79:21: por ai e mohoi dhe e kundërshtoi,
Efendi Nahi.verse 79:23: u përpoq dhe i tuboi njerëzit e thirri:
Efendi Nahi.verse 79:24: “Unë jam zoti juaj suprem (më i lartë)!
Efendi Nahi.verse 79:25: dhe, Perëndia, ia ekspozoi atij dënimin e kësaj bote dhe të botës tjetër.
Efendi Nahi.verse 79:26: Kjo është këshillë për ata që i druajnë Perëndisë.
Efendi Nahi.verse 79:27: E, çka është më vështirë: krijimi i juaj apo i qiellit? Ai e ka ndërtuar (qiellin),
Efendi Nahi.verse 79:28: lart e ka ngritur kupën e tij dhe e ka përsosur,
Efendi Nahi.verse 79:29: dhe netët e tij i ka bërë të errta, kurse ditët të ndritshme,
Efendi Nahi.verse 79:31: dhe nga ajo (toka) i nxorri ujërat dhe kullosat,
Efendi Nahi.verse 79:32: dhe malet i bëri të palëvizshme (i forcoi)
Efendi Nahi.verse 79:33: për gjallërinë tuaj dhe të bagëtive tuaja.
Efendi Nahi.verse 79:34: E, kur të arrijë vështirësia më e madhe,
Efendi Nahi.verse 79:35: Dita kur njeriu e kujton atë çka ka punuar,
Efendi Nahi.verse 79:36: dhe i tregohet skëterra çdokujt që sheh,
Efendi Nahi.verse 79:37: atëherë, ai që ka qenë kërcënues,
Efendi Nahi.verse 79:38: dhe e ka preferuar (dashtë më shumë) jetën e kësaj bote,
Efendi Nahi.verse 79:39: pë te, me të vërtetë, vendbanim është skëterra.
Efendi Nahi.verse 79:40: Kurse, ai që i druan madhërisë së Zotit të tij dhe e frenon vete nga epshet,
Efendi Nahi.verse 79:41: me të vërtetë, vendbanim i tij është xhenneti.
Efendi Nahi.verse 79:42: Të pyesin ty për Kijametin: “Kur do të ndodhë?”
Efendi Nahi.verse 79:43: Cka ka rëndësi për ty ta përmendësh atë?!
Efendi Nahi.verse 79:44: Vetëm Zoti yt di për te.
Efendi Nahi.verse 79:45: Ti je vetëm paralajmërues i atyre që i druajnë atij (Kijametit);
Efendi Nahi.verse 79:46: kurse, atë ditë, që do ta shohin atë (Kijametin), atyre do t’u duket se kanë qëndruar në këtë botë, vetëm një mbrëmje apo një mëngjes (të asaj mbrëmjeje).

null.verse 79:1: And olsun (kafirlərin canını) zorla alanlara;
null.verse 79:2: And olsun (mö'minlərin canını) rahatlıqla alanlara;
null.verse 79:4: And olsun (bir-birini) ötdükcə ötənlərə;
null.verse 79:5: And olsun işə əncam çəkənlərə (Allahın əmri ilə dünyanın işlərini idarə edən mələklərə ki, qiyamət haqdır və siz qiyamət günü dirilib haqq-hesab üçün Allahın hüzurunda duracaqsınız)!
null.verse 79:6: O gün sarsılan sarsılacaq (surun birinci üfürülməsi ilə yer, göy lərzəyə gələcək),
null.verse 79:7: Onun ardınca bir sarsıntı da olacaqdır! (Sur ikinci dəfə üfürüləcəkdir. İsrafil suru birinci dəfə çaldıqda hər şey məhv olacaq, ikinci dəfə çaldıqda isə hamı diriləcəkdir. Bunların arası dünya vaxtı ilə müqayisədə qırx il çəkəcəkdir).
null.verse 79:8: O gün ürəklər qorxub titrəyəcək,
null.verse 79:9: Gözləri (o ürəklərin sahib olduğu gözlər dəhşətdən) zəlilcəsinə yerə dikiləcəkdir.
null.verse 79:10: (Qiyaməti inkar edən kafirlər dünyada istehza ilə) deyirlər: "Doğrudanmı biz (öləndən sonra dirilib) əvvəlki vəziyyətimizə qaytarılacağıq?!
null.verse 79:11: ?zü də çürümüş sümüklər olduğumuz zamanmı?!"
null.verse 79:12: Onlar deyirlər: "Elə isə bu ziyanlı dönüşdür (çünki onun arxasında şiddətli bir əzab durur).
null.verse 79:13: (Ey kafirlər! Bu, Allah üçün çətin deyildir). Doğrudan da, o (surun axırıncı dəfə çalınması) ancaq tək bir dəhşətli səsdir (nə'rədir)!
null.verse 79:14: Onlar dərhal (qəbirlərindən çıxıb) dümdüz bir yerdə olacaqlar!
null.verse 79:15: (Ya Peyğəmbər!) Musanın hekayəti (söhbəti) sənə gəlib çatdımı?
null.verse 79:16: O zaman ki, Rəbbi ona müqəddəs Tuva vadisində belə xitab etdi:
null.verse 79:17: "Fir'onun yanına get. Cünki o, (allahlıq iddiasına düşməklə, xalqa zülm etməklə) çox azmışdır (həddini aşmışdır).
null.verse 79:18: Və de: "(Günahlardan) təmizlənmək istəyirsənmi?
null.verse 79:19: Səni Rəbbinə tərəf gətirimmi ki, (Ondan) qorxasan?"
null.verse 79:20: (Musa gəlib Allahın buyuruğunu Fir'ona ərz elədi) və ona (özünün həqiqi peyğəmbər olmasına dəlalət edən) ən böyük mö'cüzəni (əsanın dönüb əjdaha olmasını) göstərdi.
null.verse 79:21: Lakin (Fir'on Musanı) təkzib edib (ona) asi oldu.
null.verse 79:22: Sonra geri dönüb (özünə buyurulanlardan üz döndərərək fitnə-fəsad törətməyə, Musaya qarşı tədbir tökməyə) tələsdi.
null.verse 79:23: Və (ə'yan-əşrafını, bütün təbəələrini) toplayıb (onlara) belə xitab etdi:
null.verse 79:24: "Həqiqətən, mən sizin ən uca Rəbbinizəm!"
null.verse 79:25: Allah da onu axirət və dünya əzabına giriftar etdi. (Yaxud: Allah ona axırıncı və əvvəlinci sözlərinin cəzasını verdi).
null.verse 79:26: Şübhəsiz ki, bunda (Allahdan) qorxan kimsələr üçün ibrət dərsi vardır.
null.verse 79:27: (Ey kafirlər!) Sizi yaratmaq çətindir, yoxsa göyü ki (Allah) onu yaratdı;
null.verse 79:28: Qübbəsini ucaltdı, düzəldib nizama saldı;
null.verse 79:29: Gecəsini qaranlıq, gündüzünü işıqlı etdi?!
null.verse 79:30: Bundan sonra da yeri döşəyib (yayıb) düzəltdi (üstündə gəzmək və yaşamaq üçün onu yararlı hala saldı).
null.verse 79:31: Ondan suyunu və otlağını çıxartdı.
null.verse 79:33: (Bütün bunlar) sizin və heyvanlarınızın istifadəsi üçündür.
null.verse 79:34: O böyük bəla (qiyamət) gələndə,
null.verse 79:35: O gün insan nələr etdiyini (dünyadakı bütün yaxşı, pis əməllərini) yadına salacaqdır.
null.verse 79:36: Cəhənnəm də hər görənə görünəcəkdir.
null.verse 79:38: Dünyanı (axirətdən) üstün tutmuşsa,
null.verse 79:40: Amma kim (qiyamət günü) Rəbbinin hüzurunda durmaqdan qorxmuş və nəfsinə istəyini (şəfvəti) qadağan etmişsə,
null.verse 79:42: (Ya Peyğəmbər! Müşriklər) səndən o saatın nə vaxt gələcəyi (qiyamətin nə vaxt qopacağı) barəsində soruşarlar.
null.verse 79:43: Sən onu (onun vaxtını) nə bilirsən?!
null.verse 79:44: Onu sonuna qədər (bütün təfərrüatı ilə) bilmək ancaq sənin Rəbbinə məxsusdur.
null.verse 79:45: Sən ancaq ondan (qiyamətdən) xəbərdar edib çəkindirənsən!
null.verse 79:46: Onu (qiyaməti) gördükləri gün (dünyada və ya qəbir evində) yalnız bir axşam, yaxud bir səhər qaldıqlarını sanacaqlar!

null.verse 79:1: Tako Mi onih koji čupaju grubo,
null.verse 79:2: i onih koji vade blago,
null.verse 79:4: pa naređenja izvršavaju žurno
null.verse 79:5: i sređuju ono što nije sređeno...
null.verse 79:6: na Dan kada se Zemlja potresom zatrese,
null.verse 79:7: za kojim će slijediti sljedeći -
null.verse 79:8: srca toga dana biće uznemirena,
null.verse 79:10: Ovi pitaju: "Zar ćemo, zaista, biti opet ono što smo sada?
null.verse 79:11: Zar kad truhle kosti postanemo?",
null.verse 79:12: i još kažu: "E tada bismo mi bili izgubljeni!"
null.verse 79:13: A biće to samo povik jedan,
null.verse 79:14: i evo njih - na Zemlji.
null.verse 79:15: Da li je do tebe doprla vijest o Musau,
null.verse 79:16: kad ga je Gospodar njegov u svetoj dolini Tuva zovnuo,
null.verse 79:17: Idi faraonu, on se osilio,
null.verse 79:18: i reci: ’Da li bi ti da se očistiš,
null.verse 79:19: da te o Gospodaru tvome poučim, pa da Ga se bojiš?’"
null.verse 79:20: I onda mu je najveće čudo pokazao,
null.verse 79:21: ali je on porekao i nije poslušao,
null.verse 79:22: već se okrenuo i potrudio
null.verse 79:23: i sabrao
null.verse 79:24: Ja sam gospodar vaš najveći! - on je rekao,
null.verse 79:25: i Allah ga je i za ove i za one prijašnje riječi kaznio.
null.verse 79:26: To je pouka za onoga koji se bude Allaha bojao.
null.verse 79:27: A šta je teže: vas ili nebo stvoriti? On ga je sazdao,
null.verse 79:28: svod njegov visoko digao i usavršio,
null.verse 79:29: noći njegove mračnim, a dane svjetlim učinio.
null.verse 79:30: Poslije toga je Zemlju poravnao,
null.verse 79:31: iz nje je vodu i pašnjake izveo,
null.verse 79:33: na uživanje vama i stoci vašoj.
null.verse 79:34: A kada dođe nevolja najveća,
null.verse 79:35: Dan kada se čovjek bude sjećao onoga što je radio
null.verse 79:36: i kada se Džehennem svakome ko vidi bude ukazao,
null.verse 79:37: onda će onome koji je obijestan bio
null.verse 79:38: i život na ovome svijetu više volio
null.verse 79:40: A onome koji je pred dostojanstvom Gospodara svoga strepio i dušu od prohtjeva uzdržao
null.verse 79:42: Pitaju te o Smaku svijeta: "Kada će se dogoditi?"
null.verse 79:43: Ti ne znaš, pa kako da o njemu zboriš,
null.verse 79:44: o njemu samo Gospodar tvoj zna.
null.verse 79:45: Tvoja opomena će koristiti samo onome koji ga se bude bojao,
null.verse 79:46: a njima će se učiniti, onoga Dana kada ga dožive, da su samo jedno večer ili jedno jutro njezino ostali.

null.verse 79:1: শপথ সেই ফেরেশতাগণের, যারা ডুব দিয়ে আত্মা উৎপাটন করে,
null.verse 79:2: শপথ তাদের, যারা আত্মার বাঁধন খুলে দেয় মৃদুভাবে;
null.verse 79:3: শপথ তাদের, যারা সন্তরণ করে দ্রুতগতিতে,
null.verse 79:4: শপথ তাদের, যারা দ্রুতগতিতে অগ্রসর হয় এবং
null.verse 79:5: শপথ তাদের, যারা সকল কর্মনির্বাহ করে, কেয়ামত অবশ্যই হবে।
null.verse 79:6: যেদিন প্রকম্পিত করবে প্রকম্পিতকারী,
null.verse 79:7: অতঃপর পশ্চাতে আসবে পশ্চাদগামী;
null.verse 79:8: সেদিন অনেক হৃদয় ভীত-বিহবল হবে।
null.verse 79:10: তারা বলেঃ আমরা কি উলটো পায়ে প্রত্যাবর্তিত হবই-
null.verse 79:11: গলিত অস্থি হয়ে যাওয়ার পরও?
null.verse 79:12: তবে তো এ প্রত্যাবর্তন সর্বনাশা হবে!
null.verse 79:13: অতএব, এটা তো কেবল এক মহা-নাদ,
null.verse 79:14: তখনই তারা ময়দানে আবির্ভূত হবে।
null.verse 79:15: মূসার বৃত্তান্ত আপনার কাছে পৌছেছে কি?
null.verse 79:16: যখন তার পালনকর্তা তাকে পবিত্র তুয়া উপ্যকায় আহবান করেছিলেন,
null.verse 79:17: ফেরাউনের কাছে যাও, নিশ্চয় সে সীমালংঘন করেছে।
null.verse 79:18: অতঃপর বলঃ তোমার পবিত্র হওয়ার আগ্রহ আছে কি?
null.verse 79:19: আমি তোমাকে তোমার পালনকর্তার দিকে পথ দেখাব, যাতে তুমি তাকে ভয় কর।
null.verse 79:20: অতঃপর সে তাকে মহা-নিদর্শন দেখাল।
null.verse 79:21: কিন্তু সে মিথ্যারোপ করল এবং অমান্য করল।
null.verse 79:22: অতঃপর সে প্রতিকার চেষ্টায় প্রস্থান করল।
null.verse 79:23: সে সকলকে সমবেত করল এবং সজোরে আহবান করল,
null.verse 79:24: এবং বললঃ আমিই তোমাদের সেরা পালনকর্তা।
null.verse 79:25: অতঃপর আল্লাহ তাকে পরকালের ও ইহকালের শাস্তি দিলেন।
null.verse 79:26: যে ভয় করে তার জন্যে অবশ্যই এতে শিক্ষা রয়েছে।
null.verse 79:27: তোমাদের সৃষ্টি অধিক কঠিন না আকাশের, যা তিনি নির্মাণ করেছেন?
null.verse 79:28: তিনি একে উচ্চ করেছেন ও সুবিন্যস্ত করেছেন।
null.verse 79:29: তিনি এর রাত্রিকে করেছেন অন্ধকারাচ্ছন্ন এবং এর সূর্যোলোক প্রকাশ করেছেন।
null.verse 79:30: পৃথিবীকে এর পরে বিস্তৃত করেছেন।
null.verse 79:31: তিনি এর মধ্য থেকে এর পানি ও ঘাম নির্গত করেছেন,
null.verse 79:33: তোমাদের ও তোমাদের চতুস্পদ জন্তুদের উপকারার্থে।
null.verse 79:34: অতঃপর যখন মহাসংকট এসে যাবে।
null.verse 79:35: অর্থাৎ যেদিন মানুষ তার কৃতকর্ম স্মরণ করবে
null.verse 79:36: এবং দর্শকদের জন্যে জাহান্নাম প্রকাশ করা হবে,
null.verse 79:38: এবং পার্থিব জীবনকে অগ্রাধিকার দিয়েছে,
null.verse 79:40: পক্ষান্তরে যে ব্যক্তি তার পালনকর্তার সামনে দন্ডায়মান হওয়াকে ভয় করেছে এবং খেয়াল-খুশী থেকে নিজেকে নিবৃত্ত রেখেছে,
null.verse 79:42: তারা আপনাকে জিজ্ঞাসা করে, কেয়ামত কখন হবে?
null.verse 79:43: এর বর্ণনার সাথে আপনার কি সম্পর্ক ?
null.verse 79:44: এর চরম জ্ঞান আপনার পালনকর্তার কাছে।
null.verse 79:45: যে একে ভয় করে, আপনি তো কেবল তাকেই সতর্ক করবেন।
null.verse 79:46: যেদিন তারা একে দেখবে, সেদিন মনে হবে যেন তারা দুনিয়াতে মাত্র এক সন্ধ্যা অথবা এক সকাল অবস্থান করেছে।

Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 79:1: Кълна се в изтръгващите [душите] с все сила
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 79:4: и в гонещите се в надпревара,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 79:6: В Деня, когато [се протръби с първия Рог] ще се разтърси тресящата се ,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 79:8: Някои сърца в този Ден ще тръпнат.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 79:10: Ще кажат: Нима ще бъдем върнати към предишното,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 79:11: нима, след като бяхме прогнили кости?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 79:12: Ще кажат: Това тогава е завръщане със загуба.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 79:15: [О, Мухаммад], стигна ли до теб разказът за Муса?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 79:16: Когато неговият Господ го призова в свещената долина Туа:
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 79:18: И кажи: Не ще ли се пречистиш,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 79:19: да те напътя към твоя Господ и да се побоиш?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 79:21: И взе го за лъжа, и се възпротиви.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 79:25: И Аллах го сграбчи с наказание в отвъдния и в земния живот.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 79:26: В това има поучение за всеки богобоязлив.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 79:27: Вие ли сте по-трудни за сътворяване или небето? Той го съгради.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 79:28: Въздигна неговия свод и го изравни,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 79:29: и потъмни нощта му, и изведе утрото му,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 79:31: Извади от нея водите и пасбищата й,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 79:33: за ползване от вас и от вашия добитък.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 79:35: тогава в Деня човек ще си припомни за какво се е старал,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 79:36: и Адът ще бъде показан на всеки, който вижда...
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 79:40: За който се е страхувал да не застане пред своя Господ [с грях] и е въздържал душата от страстта,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 79:42: Питат те [о, Мухаммад] за Часа: Кога ще настъпи?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 79:43: Какво [знание имаш] ти да го споменеш?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 79:44: При твоя Господ е пределът му.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 79:45: Ти си само предупредител за всеки, който се страхува от него.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 79:46: В Деня, когато го видят, те сякаш ще са пребивавали само една привечер или утрин.

null.verse 79:1: 誓以急掣的，
null.verse 79:2: 輕曳的，
null.verse 79:4: 先驅的，
null.verse 79:5: 決策的，
null.verse 79:6: 當震動者震動，
null.verse 79:7: 而續髮者續髮之日，
null.verse 79:8: 在那日，許多心將忐忑不安，
null.verse 79:10: 他們說：「我們必定復元嗎？
null.verse 79:11: 那是在我們已變成朽骨的時候嗎？」
null.verse 79:12: 他們說：「然則，那是一次虧折的復原。」
null.verse 79:13: 那只是一次吼聲，
null.verse 79:14: 他們忽然在地面之上。
null.verse 79:15: 穆薩的故事已來臨你了嗎？
null.verse 79:16: 當時，他的主，曾在聖谷杜洼中召喚他說：
null.verse 79:17: 「你到法老那裡去吧！他確是悖逆的。
null.verse 79:18: 你對他說：『你願意成為純潔的人嗎？
null.verse 79:19: 你願意我引導你認識你的主，而你畏懼他嗎？』」
null.verse 79:20: 他把那最大的跡象昭示了法老，
null.verse 79:21: 但他否認，而且違抗。
null.verse 79:22: 然後，他轉身而奔走。
null.verse 79:23: 於是，召集民眾，而且喊叫，
null.verse 79:24: 說：「我是你們的至尊的主。」
null.verse 79:25: 故真主以後世和今世的刑罰懲治他。
null.verse 79:26: 對於畏懼的人們，此中確有一種鑒戒。
null.verse 79:27: 你們是更難造的呢？還是天是更難造的呢？他曾建造了天，
null.verse 79:28: 他升起它的高度，而成全它的形體，
null.verse 79:29: 他使它的夜間黑暗，並顯出它的光明。
null.verse 79:30: 此後，他將地面展開，
null.verse 79:31: 他使地面涌出泉水來，生出植物來。
null.verse 79:33: 以便你們和你們的牲畜獲得享受。
null.verse 79:34: 大難來臨的時候，
null.verse 79:35: 就是人將記起自己所作的善惡，
null.verse 79:36: 火獄將為能見的人顯露出來的日子。
null.verse 79:38: 而且選擇今世生活的人，
null.verse 79:40: 至於怕站在主的御前受審問，並戒除私慾的人，
null.verse 79:42: 他們問你復活時在什麼時候實現，
null.verse 79:43: 你怎能說明它呢？
null.verse 79:44: 惟有你的主能知它的究竟。
null.verse 79:45: 你的警告只有裨於畏懼它的人，
null.verse 79:46: 他們在見它的那日，好像在墳裡只逗留過一朝或一夕。

null.verse 79:1: Při silou vytrhujících,
null.verse 79:2: při čile prohánějících,
null.verse 79:4: při usilovně se předbíhajících,
null.verse 79:5: při rozkazy uspořádávajících!
null.verse 79:6: V den, kdy rozezní se znějící
null.verse 79:7: a přijde po ní následující,
null.verse 79:8: v ten den se všechna srdce rozbuší
null.verse 79:9: a zraky jejich se hanbou zkruší!
null.verse 79:10: Říkají: "Což vskutku budeme vráceni v stav původní,
null.verse 79:11: až staneme se kostmi zpráchnivělými?"
null.verse 79:12: A připojí: "To věru návrat byl by záhubný!"
null.verse 79:13: A ozve se jen zvuk jediný,
null.verse 79:14: a hle, octnou se bdící na zemi!
null.verse 79:15: Zdaž donesla se ti o Mojžíšovi zpráva,
null.verse 79:16: když Pán jeho naň zavolal v údolí posvátném Tuwá:
null.verse 79:17: K Faraónovi se vydej, neb on věru zpupným se projevil,
null.verse 79:18: a rci mu: "Což se nepatří, aby ses očistil
null.verse 79:19: a já abych tě dovedl k Pánu tvému a ty se Ho bál?"
null.verse 79:20: A znamení největší mu ukázal,
null.verse 79:21: však ten za lež je prohlásil a neposlušný byl,
null.verse 79:22: pak zády se otočil a pryč pospíšil
null.verse 79:23: a lidi své si shromáždil a pak prohlásil:
null.verse 79:24: Já vaším pánem jsem nejvyšším!
null.verse 79:25: A učinil jej Bůh na onom i tomto světě trestem varovným,
null.verse 79:26: a pro toho, kdo naplněn je bázní, to věru bude poučením!
null.verse 79:27: Jste obtížnější pro stvoření vy, anebo nebe? On je vystavěl,
null.verse 79:28: v klenbu je vyzvedl a vhodně vyrovnal,
null.verse 79:29: temnotou noc jeho zahalil a jasu dennímu z něho vzejít dal
null.verse 79:30: a zemi posléze rozprostřel,
null.verse 79:31: a aby voda i pastviny na ní vzešly, způsobil
null.verse 79:33: aby užitek v tom pro vás i vaše stáda byl.
null.verse 79:34: A až nadejde ten převrat nesmírný
null.verse 79:35: v den, kdy člověk si vzpomene na všechno své snažení,
null.verse 79:36: tehdy předvedeno bude peklo tomu, kdo uvidí.
null.verse 79:38: a život pozemský si oblíbili,
null.verse 79:39: těm věru peklo za útulek připravili.
null.verse 79:40: Však ten, jenž postavení Pána svého se bál a duši svou před vášní spasil,
null.verse 79:41: ten věru v zahradě rajské svůj bude mít azyl.
null.verse 79:42: Budou se tě na Hodinu, a kdy má nastat, ptát;
null.verse 79:43: proč ty máš se vlastně o ní zmiňovat?
null.verse 79:44: Vždyť Pánu tvému patří lhůta její konečná!
null.verse 79:45: Ty jen varovatelem jsi toho, jenž obavu z ní má.
null.verse 79:46: A v den, kdy spatří ji, bude se jim zdát, jako by v hrobech svých víc než večer či jitro nestrávili.

null.verse 79:1: Bij hen die zich volledig inspannen,
null.verse 79:2: En bij hen die hun werk met vreugde verrichten,
null.verse 79:3: En bij hen die snelle vorderingen maken.
null.verse 79:4: En bij hen die de eersten willen zijn
null.verse 79:5: En bij hen die de zaak regelen.
null.verse 79:6: De Dag waarop de bevende (aarde) zal beven,
null.verse 79:7: Hierop zal volgen, wat volgen moet.
null.verse 79:8: Op die Dag zullen de harten kloppen.
null.verse 79:9: En de ogen zullen nedergeslagen zijn.
null.verse 79:10: Zij (de ongelovigen) zeggen: "Zullen wij werkelijk tot onze vroegere toestand worden teruggebracht,
null.verse 79:11: Zelfs al zijn wij vergane beenderen geworden?"
null.verse 79:12: Zij zeggen: "Dan zou deze opstanding een ondergang zijn."
null.verse 79:13: Daar is slechts één dreigende roep.
null.verse 79:14: En ziet, zij zijn opgewekt.
null.verse 79:15: Heeft het verhaal van Mozes u niet bereikt?
null.verse 79:16: Toen zijn Heer hem in het heilige dal van Towa toeriep, (zeggende):
null.verse 79:17: "Ga naar Pharao; want hij is opstandig.
null.verse 79:18: En zeg tot hem: Zoudt gij u willen reinigen?
null.verse 79:19: En ik zal u tot uw Heer leiden opdat gij Hem moogt vrezen."
null.verse 79:20: Toen toonde hij hem (Pharao) het grote teken,
null.verse 79:21: Maar deze verwierp het en gehoorzaamde niet;
null.verse 79:22: Maar wendde zich daarna haastig af.
null.verse 79:23: En hij (Pharao) verzamelde de zijnen en riep uit:
null.verse 79:24: (Zeggende), "Ik ben uw Heer de Allerhoogste."
null.verse 79:25: Daarop greep God hem aan met een voorbeeldige straf voor de toekomst en voor die tijd.
null.verse 79:26: Waarlijk daarin is een les voor hem die vreest.
null.verse 79:27: Zijt gij moeilijker te scheppen dan de hemel die Hij heeft gebouwd?
null.verse 79:28: Hij verhief hem hoog en maakte hem volmaakt.
null.verse 79:29: En Hij maakte de nacht donker en bracht het daglicht voort;
null.verse 79:30: En ook de aarde spreidde hij uit.
null.verse 79:31: Daaruit bracht Hij water en weide voort.
null.verse 79:32: En Hij maakte de bergen onwrikbaar.
null.verse 79:33: Een voorziening voor u en voor uw vee.
null.verse 79:34: Maar als de grote ramp zal komen,
null.verse 79:35: De Dag waarop de mens zich zal herinneren hetgeen hij heeft gedaan,
null.verse 79:36: En de hel zal zichtbaar gemaakt worden voor hem die ziet.
null.verse 79:37: Dan zal (voor hem) die opstandig is geweest,
null.verse 79:38: En die het leven dezer wereld verkoos,
null.verse 79:40: Doch voor hem die vreesde voor zijn Heer te staan, en die zijn ziel van begeerten onthield,
null.verse 79:41: Zal het paradijs zeker zijn verblijf zijn.
null.verse 79:42: Zij vragen u omtrent het Uur: "Wanneer zal het komen?"
null.verse 79:43: Maar datgene waarmede gij u bezighoudt
null.verse 79:44: De uitkomst daarvan is bij uw Heer.
null.verse 79:45: Gij zijt slechts een waarschuwer voor hem die vreest.
null.verse 79:46: Op de dag waarop zij dit zullen zien, (zal het zijn) alsof zij slechts een avond of een morgen (op de aarde) hadden vertoefd.

Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 79:1: By those who drag forth to destruction,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 79:5: And those who govern the event,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 79:6: On the day when the first trump resoundeth.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 79:8: On that day hearts beat painfully
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 79:10: (Now) they are saying: Shall we really be restored to our first state
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 79:11: Even after we are crumbled bones ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 79:12: They say: Then that would be a vain proceeding.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 79:13: Surely it will need but one shout,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 79:14: And lo! they will be awakened.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 79:15: Hath there come unto thee the history of Moses ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 79:16: How his Lord called him in the holy vale of Tuwa,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 79:17: (Saying:) Go thou unto Pharaoh - Lo! he hath rebelled -
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 79:18: And say (unto him): Hast thou (will) to grow (in grace) ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 79:19: Then I will guide thee to thy Lord and thou shalt fear (Him).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 79:20: And he showed him the tremendous token.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 79:22: Then turned he away in haste,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 79:24: And proclaimed: "I (Pharaoh) am your Lord the Highest."
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 79:25: So Allah seized him (and made him) an example for the after (life) and for the former.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 79:26: Lo! herein is indeed a lesson for him who feareth.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 79:27: Are ye the harder to create, or is the heaven that He built ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 79:28: He raised the height thereof and ordered it;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 79:29: And He made dark the night thereof, and He brought forth the morn thereof.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 79:30: And after that He spread the earth,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 79:31: And produced therefrom the water thereof and the pasture thereof,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 79:32: And He made fast the hills,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 79:33: A provision for you and for your cattle.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 79:34: But when the great disaster cometh,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 79:35: The day when man will call to mind his (whole) endeavour,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 79:36: And hell will stand forth visible to him who seeth,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 79:37: Then, as for him who rebelled
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 79:38: And chose the life of the world,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 79:39: Lo! hell will be his home.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 79:40: But as for him who feared to stand before his Lord and restrained his soul from lust,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 79:41: Lo! the Garden will be his home.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 79:42: They ask thee of the Hour: when will it come to port ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 79:43: Why (ask they) ? What hast thou to tell thereof ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 79:44: Unto thy Lord belongeth (knowledge of) the term thereof.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 79:45: Thou art but a warner unto him who feareth it.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 79:46: On the day when they behold it, it will be as if they had but tarried for an evening or the morn thereof.

Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 79:1: By the (angels) who tear out (the souls of the wicked) with violence;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 79:2: By those who gently draw out (the souls of the blessed);
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 79:3: And by those who glide along (on errands of mercy),
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 79:4: Then press forward as in a race,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 79:5: Then arrange to do (the Commands of their Lord),
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 79:6: One Day everything that can be in commotion will be in violent commotion,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 79:8: Hearts that Day will be in agitation;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 79:9: Cast down will be (their owners’) eyes.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 79:10: They say (now): "What! shall we indeed be returned to (our) former state?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 79:11: "What! - when we shall have become rotten bones?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 79:12: They say: "It would, in that case, be a return with loss!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 79:13: But verily, it will be but a single (Compelling) Cry,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 79:14: When, behold, they will be in the (full) awakening (to Judgment).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 79:15: Has the story of Moses reached thee?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 79:16: Behold, thy Lord did call to him in the sacred valley of Tuwa:-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 79:17: "Go thou to Pharaoh for he has indeed transgressed all bounds:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 79:18: "And say to him, ’Wouldst thou that thou shouldst be purified (from sin)?-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 79:19: "’And that I guide thee to thy Lord, so thou shouldst fear Him?’"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 79:20: Then did (Moses) show him the Great Sign.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 79:22: Further, he turned his back, striving hard (against God).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 79:23: Then he collected (his men) and made a proclamation,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 79:24: Saying, "I am your Lord, Most High".
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 79:25: But God did punish him, (and made an) example of him, - in the Hereafter, as in this life.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 79:26: Verily in this is an instructive warning for whosoever feareth (God).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 79:27: What! Are ye the more difficult to create or the heaven (above)? (God) hath constructed it:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 79:28: On high hath He raised its canopy, and He hath given it order and perfection.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 79:29: Its night doth He endow with darkness, and its splendour doth He bring out (with light).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 79:30: And the earth, moreover, hath He extended (to a wide expanse);
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 79:31: He draweth out therefrom its moisture and its pasture;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 79:32: And the mountains hath He firmly fixed;-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 79:33: For use and convenience to you and your cattle.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 79:34: Therefore, when there comes the great, overwhelming (Event),-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 79:35: The Day when man shall remember (all) that he strove for,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 79:36: And Hell-Fire shall be placed in full view for (all) to see,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 79:37: Then, for such as had transgressed all bounds,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 79:38: And had preferred the life of this world,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 79:40: And for such as had entertained the fear of standing before their Lord’s (tribunal) and had restrained (their) soul from lower desires,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 79:41: Their abode will be the Garden.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 79:42: They ask thee about the Hour,-’When will be its appointed time?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 79:43: Wherein art thou (concerned) with the declaration thereof?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 79:44: With thy Lord in the Limit fixed therefor.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 79:45: Thou art but a Warner for such as fear it.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 79:46: The Day they see it, (It will be) as if they had tarried but a single evening, or (at most till) the following morn!

Arthur J. Arberry.verse 79:1: By those that pluck out vehemently
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 79:2: and those that draw out violently,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 79:5: by those that direct an affair!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 79:6: Upon the day when the first blast shivers
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 79:7: and the second blast follows it,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 79:8: hearts upon that day shall be athrob
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 79:9: and their eyes shall be humbled.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 79:10: They shall say, ’What, are we being restored as we were before?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 79:11: What, when we are bones old and wasted?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 79:12: They shall say, ’That then were a losing return!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 79:13: But it shall be only a single scare,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 79:15: Hast thou received the story of Moses?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 79:16: When his Lord called to him in the holy valley, Towa:
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 79:17: ’Go to Pharaoh; he has waxed insolent.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 79:18: And say, "Hast thou the will to purify thyself;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 79:19: and that I should guide thee to thy Lord, then thou shalt fear?"’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 79:20: So he showed him the great sign,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 79:21: but he cried lies, and rebelled,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 79:24: and proclaimed, and he said, ’I am your Lord, the Most High!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 79:25: So God seized him with the chastisement of the Last World and the First.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 79:26: Surely in that is a lesson for him who fears!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 79:27: What, are you stronger in constitution or the heaven He built?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 79:28: He lifted up its vault, and levelled it,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 79:29: and darkened its night, and brought forth its forenoon;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 79:30: and the earth-after that He spread it out,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 79:31: therefrom brought forth its waters and its pastures,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 79:32: and the mountains He set firm,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 79:33: an enjoyment for you and your flocks.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 79:34: Then, when the Great Catastrophe comes
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 79:35: upon the day when man shall remember what he has striven,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 79:36: and Hell is advanced for whoever sees,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 79:37: then as for him who was insolent
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 79:39: surely Hell shall be the refuge.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 79:40: But as for him who feared the Station of his Lord and forbade the soul its caprice,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 79:41: surely Paradise shall be the refuge.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 79:42: They will question thee concerning the Hour, when it shall berth.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 79:43: What art thou about, to mention it?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 79:44: Unto thy Lord is the final end of it.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 79:45: Thou art only the warner of him who fears it.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 79:46: It shall be as if; on the day they see it, they have but tarried for an evening, or its forenoon.

Muhammad Asad.verse 79:1: CONSIDER those [stars] that rise only to set,
Muhammad Asad.verse 79:2: and move [in their orbits] with steady motion,
Muhammad Asad.verse 79:3: and float [through space] with floating serene,
Muhammad Asad.verse 79:4: and yet overtake [one another] with swift overtaking:
Muhammad Asad.verse 79:5: and thus they fulfil the [Creator’s] behest!
Muhammad Asad.verse 79:6: [HENCE, think of] the Day when a violent convulsion will convulse [the world],
Muhammad Asad.verse 79:8: On that Day will [men’s] hearts be throbbing,
Muhammad Asad.verse 79:10: [And yet,] some say, "What! Are we indeed to be restored to our former state –
Muhammad Asad.verse 79:11: even though we may have become [a heap of] crumbling bones?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 79:12: [And] they add, "That, then, would be a return with loss!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 79:13: [But,] then, that [Last Hour] will be [upon them of a sudden, as if it were] but a single accusing cry –
Muhammad Asad.verse 79:14: and then, lo, they will be fully awakened [to the truth]!
Muhammad Asad.verse 79:15: HAS THE STORY of Moses ever come within thy ken?
Muhammad Asad.verse 79:16: Lo! His Sustainer called out to him in the twice-hallowed valley:
Muhammad Asad.verse 79:17: "Go unto Pharaoh – for, verily, he has transgressed all bounds of what is right –
Muhammad Asad.verse 79:18: and say [unto him], ‘Art thou desirous of attaining to purity?
Muhammad Asad.verse 79:19: [If so,] then I shall guide thee towards [a cognition of] thy Sustainer, so that [henceforth] thou wilt stand in awe [of Him].’"
Muhammad Asad.verse 79:20: And thereupon he [went to Pharaoh and] made him aware of the great wonder [of God’s grace].
Muhammad Asad.verse 79:21: But [Pharaoh] gave him the lie and rebelliously rejected [all guidance],
Muhammad Asad.verse 79:22: and brusquely turned his back [on Moses];
Muhammad Asad.verse 79:23: and then he gathered [his great ones], and called [unto his people],
Muhammad Asad.verse 79:24: and said, "I am your Lord All-Highest!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 79:25: And thereupon God took him to task, [and made him] a warning example in the life to come as well as in this world.
Muhammad Asad.verse 79:26: In this, behold, there is a lesson indeed for all who stand in awe [of God].
Muhammad Asad.verse 79:27: [O MEN!] Are you more difficult to create than the heaven which He has built?
Muhammad Asad.verse 79:28: High has He reared its vault and formed it in accordance with what it was meant to be;
Muhammad Asad.verse 79:29: and He has made dark its night and brought forth its light of day.
Muhammad Asad.verse 79:30: And after that, the earth: wide has He spread its expanse,
Muhammad Asad.verse 79:31: and has caused its waters to come out of it, and its pastures,
Muhammad Asad.verse 79:32: and has made the mountains firm:
Muhammad Asad.verse 79:33: [all this] as a means of livelihood for you and your animals.
Muhammad Asad.verse 79:34: AND SO, when the great, overwhelming event [of resurrection] comes to pass –
Muhammad Asad.verse 79:35: on that Day man will [clearly] remember all that he has ever wrought;
Muhammad Asad.verse 79:36: and the blazing fire [of hell] will be laid open before all who [are destined to] see it.
Muhammad Asad.verse 79:37: For unto him who shall have transgressed the bounds of what is right,
Muhammad Asad.verse 79:38: and preferred the life of this world [to the good of his soul],
Muhammad Asad.verse 79:39: that blazing fire will truly be the goal!
Muhammad Asad.verse 79:40: But unto him who shall have stood in fear of his Sustainer’s Presence, and held back his inner self from base desires,
Muhammad Asad.verse 79:41: paradise will truly be the goal!
Muhammad Asad.verse 79:42: THEY WILL ASK thee [O Prophet] about the Last Hours: "When will it come to pass?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 79:43: [But] how couldst thou tell anything about it,
Muhammad Asad.verse 79:44: [seeing that] with thy Sustainer alone rests the beginning and the end [of all knowledge] thereof?
Muhammad Asad.verse 79:45: Thou art but [sent] to warn those who stand in awe of it.
Muhammad Asad.verse 79:46: On the Day when they behold it, [it will seem to them] as if they had tarried [in this world] no longer than one evening or [one night, ending with] its morn!

Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 79:1: I swear by those (angels) who pull out (the souls of the infidels) with extreme force,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 79:2: and by those (angels) who untie the knot (of the souls of the believers) smoothly,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 79:3: and by those who float (in the atmosphere) swiftly,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 79:5: then manage (to do) everything (they are ordered to do,)
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 79:6: (you will be resurrected) on the Day when the shocking event (i.e. the first blowing of the trumpet) will shock (everything),
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 79:7: followed by the next one (i.e. the second blowing of the trumpet.)
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 79:8: On that day, hearts (of people) will be throbbing,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 79:10: They (the infidels) say, “Are we going to be brought back to our former state (of Life)?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 79:11: Is it when we are turned into decayed bones?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 79:12: They say, “If so, that will be a harmful homecoming.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 79:13: In fact, it will be only a single harsh voice,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 79:14: and in no time they will be (brought) into the plain (of Hashr).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 79:15: Has there come to you the narrative about Mūsā?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 79:16: (Recall) when his Lord called to him in the blessed valley of Tuwā:
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 79:17: “Go to Fir‘aun (Pharaoh). Indeed, he has crossed all bounds.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 79:18: And say (to him,) ‘Would you like to purify yourself,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 79:19: and that I should guide you to your Lord, so that you fear (Him)?’”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 79:20: So, he (Mūsā) showed him the biggest sign.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 79:22: then he turned back, and tried hard (to refute the Messenger),
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 79:23: then he gathered (his people) and shouted
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 79:24: and said, “I am your supreme lord.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 79:25: So, Allah seized him for an exemplary punishment in the Hereafter and the present world.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 79:26: Indeed, there is a lesson for him who fears (Allah).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 79:27: Is your creation more difficult or that of the sky? He has built it,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 79:28: He has raised its height, then made it proper,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 79:29: and darkened its night, and brought forth its daylight,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 79:30: and, after that, He spread out the earth.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 79:31: From it, He brought out its water and its meadows,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 79:33: (all this) as a benefit to you and your cattle.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 79:34: So when the Greatest Havoc will take place
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 79:35: on the day when man will recall what he did,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 79:36: and the Hell will be exposed for all who see,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 79:37: then for the one who had rebelled,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 79:38: and preferred the worldly life (to the Hereafter),
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 79:39: the Hell will be the abode,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 79:40: whereas for the one who feared to stand before his Lord, and restrained his self from the (evil) desire,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 79:41: the Paradise will be the abode.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 79:42: They ask you (O Prophet,) about the Hour (the Day of Judgment) as to when it will take place.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 79:43: In which capacity are you to tell this?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 79:44: With your Lord is the final word about it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 79:45: You are only a warner for anyone who fears it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 79:46: The day they will see it, it will seem to them as if they did not live (in the world) but only for one afternoon or for the morning thereof.

Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 79:2: by those that draw out gently;
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 79:5: and by those that direct the affair:
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 79:6: the day when the Tremor quakes,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 79:7: and is followed by the Aftershock;
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 79:8: on that day hearts will be trembling,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 79:10: They will say: ‘Are we indeed being restored as before?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 79:11: What! When we have been decayed bones?’
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 79:12: They will say, ‘That then would be a ruinous return!’
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 79:13: But it will be only a single blast:
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 79:14: behold, then, they will be upon the surface of the earth.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 79:15: Have you received the story of Moses,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 79:16: when his Lord called out to him in the holy valley of Tuwā?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 79:17: ‘Go to Pharaoh; he has indeed become rebellious,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 79:19: and allow me to guide you to your Lord so that you may have fear [of Him]?” ’
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 79:20: So he showed him the greatest sign.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 79:22: Then he turned his back, going about in haste.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 79:24: and said, ‘I am your most high lord!’
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 79:25: So God seized him as punishment for the latter and for the former.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 79:26: Assuredly in that there is a moral for him who fears.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 79:27: Are you harder to create or the heaven which He has built?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 79:28: He made it rise high and levelled it,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 79:29: and darkened its night, and brought forth its day;
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 79:30: and after that He spread out the earth;
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 79:31: from it He has brought forth its waters and its pastures,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 79:32: and has set firm the mountains
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 79:33: as a [source of] sustenance for you and your flocks.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 79:34: So when the Greatest Catastrophe befalls,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 79:35: the day when man will remember his efforts,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 79:36: and the Hell-fire is revealed for all to see:
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 79:37: as for him who was rebellious,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 79:38: and preferred the life of this world,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 79:39: Hell-fire will indeed be the abode.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 79:40: But as for him who feared the stance before his Lord, and forbade the soul from [pursuing] desire,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 79:41: Paradise will indeed be the abode.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 79:42: They will ask you about the Hour: when will it set in?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 79:43: What have you to do with the mention of it?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 79:44: With your Lord it belongs ultimately.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 79:45: You are only a warner for the one who fears it.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 79:46: The day they see it, it will be as if they had only tarried for an evening or the morning thereof.

Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 79:1: By the (angels) who violently snatch out (the souls of the disbelievers from each tendon and ligament of their body), Or By the waves of energy that pierce into matter and break up the chemical bonds fiercely,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 79:2: And by the (angels) who unweave sinews (of the believers’ organisms) gently and peacefully, Or By the waves of energy that disintegrate gently and peacefully the chemical bonds within matter,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 79:3: And by the (angels) who swiftly glide (between the heavens and the earth), Or By the waves of energy that move around freely in space and atmosphere,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 79:4: Then by the (angels) who with burst of speed sprint past others, Or By the waves of energy that surpass other waves in speed, force and assimilation,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 79:5: Then by the (angels) who manage different affairs well, Or By the waves of energy that, through mutual dynamism and coordination, maintain equilibrium and keep the balance of the management going for the survival of the system of the universe,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 79:6: (When they will be commanded to devastate the system of the universe) that Day, everything in motion (in the universe) will tremor into violent convulsion,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 79:8: That Day, hearts (of the people) will pound with agony and terror.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 79:9: Their eyes will be downcast (with dread and horror).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 79:10: The disbelievers say: ‘Shall we be reverted to the former life?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 79:11: (Shall we be given life even) when we shall have become rotten (hollow) bones?’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 79:12: They say: ‘This (return) would then be a losing return.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 79:13: Then it will be rending (of all heavenly bodies) asunder with single extremely horrible explosion.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 79:14: Then they (all) will forgather suddenly in the open expanse (for assembly).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 79:15: Has the account of Musa (Moses) reached you?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 79:16: When His Lord called out to him in the sacred valley of Tuwa,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 79:17: (And commanded:) ‘Go to Pharaoh. He has transgressed all bounds.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 79:18: Then say (to him): ‘Do you wish that you should be purified?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 79:19: And (do you desire that) I guide you to your Lord so that you may fear (Him)?’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 79:20: Then Musa (Moses) showed him the great sign.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 79:21: But he denied it and disobeyed.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 79:22: Then, turning away (from the truth), he launched struggle (in rivalry against Musa ).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 79:23: So he gathered (people) and started calling out,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 79:24: And said: ‘I am your lord, most high.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 79:25: Then Allah seized him in (dual) punishment of this world and the Hereafter.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 79:26: Surely, in this (incident) there is a great lesson of warning for him who fears (Allah).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 79:27: Is it you who are harder to create, or (the entire) galactic universe that He has built?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 79:28: He raised high all the heavenly spheres (planets, after creating them in the infinite cosmos), then moderated, equipoised and stabilized (their composition, construction, functions and movements).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 79:29: And He is the One Who blackened the night of heavenly space (i.e., darkened the entire spatial environment like a murky night) and emitted (after creating) the light of these (planets from this space).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 79:30: And He is the One Who, later, (after the creation of the planet sun) separated (from it) the earth, flung it with centrifugal force (and spread its expanse to make it inhabitable).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 79:31: He is the One Who drew water from the earth (separately), and brought forth its vegetable kingdom (from the rest of the dry regions).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 79:32: And He is the One Who (putting together different elements) raised from the earth firmly fixed mountains.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 79:33: (He did all this) for the benefit of you and your livestock.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 79:34: Then, whilst (the universe) attains (to its acme through evolution), there will befall the great all-encompassing calamity (the Hour of Resurrection).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 79:35: That Day man will retrospect his (every) effort and action.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 79:36: And Hell will be made manifest to everyone who can see.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 79:37: Then he who transgressed the limits,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 79:38: And preferred the life of the world (to the Hereafter),
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 79:40: But as for him who feared standing in the presence of his Lord and forbade (his ill-commanding) self its appetites and lusts,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 79:42: (The disbelievers) ask you about the Hour of Rising: ‘When will it come to pass?’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 79:43: What should be your concern in talking about (its appointed time)?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 79:44: Its ultimate limit is up to your Lord (i.e., as in the beginning, only Oneness will survive in the end as well).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 79:45: You are but a Warner to him who fears it.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 79:46: So the Day when they will see it, they (will feel as if they) did not tarry (in the world) but for one evening or one morning.

null.verse 79:1: Niiden nimessä, jotka kaikin voimin (jousiaan) jännittävät,
null.verse 79:2: niiden (nuolten), jotka vinhasti eteenpäin syöksyvät,
null.verse 79:4: ja jotka ensimmäisinä kiitävät,
null.verse 79:5: sekä vihdoin niiden (johtajaan), jotka voiton turvaavat.
null.verse 79:6: Sinä päivänä, jolloin järkkyvä maa järkkyy
null.verse 79:7: ja se tapahtuu, minkä tuleman pitää,
null.verse 79:8: sinä päivänä sydämet vavahtavat
null.verse 79:10: He arvelevat: »Palautetaanko meidät todella entiseen tilaamme?
null.verse 79:11: Kuinka! Kun jo luummekin ovat lahonneet!»
null.verse 79:12: He sanovat: »Sellainen paluu olisi turmiota tuottava.»
null.verse 79:13: Mutta kaikki muuttuu pelkäksi huudoksi
null.verse 79:14: ja katso, he heräävät!
null.verse 79:15: Eikö teille julistettu sanomaa Mooseksesta?
null.verse 79:16: Kuinka hänen Herransa kahdesti kutsui häntä pyhässä laaksossa:
null.verse 79:17: »Mene faraon luo! Hän on totisesti synteihin vaipunut.
null.verse 79:18: Ja sano: 'Tahdotko puhdistua?
null.verse 79:19: Minä johdan sinut Herrasi luo, jotta pelkäisit Häntä.'»
null.verse 79:20: Ja hän näytti faraolle suuren tunnusmerkin,
null.verse 79:21: mutta tämä hylkäsi totuuden eikä totellut.
null.verse 79:22: Sitten käänsi hän hänelle äkkiä selkänsä,
null.verse 79:23: kokosi joukon ihmisiä ja huusi heille
null.verse 79:24: sanoen: »Minä olen teidän ylin herranne.»
null.verse 79:25: Silloin Jumala yllätti hänet rangaisten sekä tässä että tulevassa elämässä.
null.verse 79:26: Totisesti on tässä varoittava esimerkki sille, joka pelkää Jumalaa.
null.verse 79:27: Kumpi on vaikeampi luoda, teidät vai taivas, jonka Hän on rakentanut?
null.verse 79:28: Hän on sen korkealle kohottanut ja sille muodon antanut:
null.verse 79:29: yöksi Hän täyttää sen pimeydellä, ja siitä hän vetää taas esiin päivänvalon.
null.verse 79:30: Ja sitten hän ulotti maan avaraksi
null.verse 79:31: ja kohotti sen vedet pinnalle sekä levitti laitumet;
null.verse 79:33: kaiken tämän teidän ja karjanne hyväksi.
null.verse 79:34: Mutta kun valtava tuhon päivä tulee,
null.verse 79:35: päivä, jona ihminen muistaa, mitä hän on tavoitellut,
null.verse 79:36: ja helvetti paljastuu näkeväiselle,
null.verse 79:38: ja pitää parempana maallista elämää,
null.verse 79:40: Mutta se, joka pelkää Herransa tulemista ja hillitsee sielunsa alhaiset himot,
null.verse 79:42: Tuota hetkeä he kysyvät sinulta; milloin sen pitää tuleman?
null.verse 79:43: Mutta kuinka voit sen sanoa?
null.verse 79:44: Onhan sen tulo Herrasi käsissä.
null.verse 79:45: Sinä olet vain varoittaja jokaiselle, joka sitä kavahtaa.
null.verse 79:46: Päivänä, jolloin he saavat nähdä sen, on heistä kuin he olisivat odottaneet sitä vain illan tai aamun.

Jean-Louis Michon.verse 79:1: Par ceux qui arrachent avec violence,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 79:2: Par ceux qui s'activent avec soin,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 79:3: Par ceux qui nagent avec rapidité,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 79:4: Par ceux qui prennent les devants
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 79:5: et mettent en oeuvre le décret !
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 79:6: Le Jour où surviendra la première commotion,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 79:8: ce jour-là les cœurs seront saisis de crainte,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 79:10: Ils diront : " Est-il vrai que nous serons ramenés à notre état antérieur
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 79:11: alors même que nous serons des ossements décharnés ? "
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 79:12: " Ce serait un retour désastreux ! ", diront-ils encore.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 79:13: Mais il suffira que retentisse un seul cri
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 79:16: lorsque son Seigneur l'appela dans la vallée sainte de Tuwa ?
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 79:17: " Va trouver Pharaon, qui est vraiment rebelle,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 79:18: et dis-lui : " Es-tu disposé à te purifier,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 79:19: à ce que je te guide vers ton Seigneur et que tu Le craignes ? "
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 79:20: Puis il lui montra le signe majeur.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 79:21: Mais Pharaon cria au mensonge et s'insurgea ;
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 79:22: puis il tourna précipitamment le dos.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 79:23: Il fit rassembler des hommes et lança une proclamation,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 79:24: disant : " Je suis votre souverain suprême ! "
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 79:25: Dieu lui infligea alors le tourment de l'Au-delà et de l'Ici-bas.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 79:26: Certes, il y a là un enseignement pour quiconque éprouve la crainte.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 79:27: A-t-il été plus difficile de vous créer que de créer le ciel ? Il l'a édifié,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 79:28: Il en a élevé la voûte et Il l'a ordonné harmonieusement.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 79:29: Il a assombri sa nuit et a fait luire sa clarté matinale.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 79:30: La terre, ensuite, Il l'a étendue.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 79:31: Il a fait surgir son eau et ses pâturages.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 79:32: Il a solidement amarré les montagnes
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 79:33: pour votre bien-être et celui de vos troupeaux.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 79:35: le Jour où l'homme se souviendra de ce qu'il s'efforçait d'atteindre
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 79:36: et où la Fournaise se montrera aux yeux de tous,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 79:37: alors, pour celui qui se sera révolté,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 79:38: pour celui qui aura donné la préférence à la vie de ce monde,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 79:40: Mais pour celui qui aura redouté de comparaître devant son Seigneur et qui aura préservé son âme de la passion,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 79:41: c'est le Paradis qui sera un refuge.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 79:42: Ils t'interrogent au sujet de l'Heure : " A quand sa venue ? "
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 79:44: C'est à ton Seigneur d'en fixer le terme.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 79:45: Toi, tu n'es que l'avertisseur de ceux qui la craignent.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 79:46: Le jour où ils la verront, ce sera comme s'ils n'étaient demeurés [dans leurs tombes] qu'un soir ou une matinée.

Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 79:2: Et par ceux qui recueillent avec douceur !
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 79:3: Et par ceux qui voguent librement,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 79:6: Le jour où [la terre] tremblera [au premier son du clairon]
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 79:8: Ce jour-là, il y aura des coeurs qui seront agités d’effroi,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 79:10: Ils disent : «Quoi ! Serons-nous ramenés à notre vie première,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 79:12: Ils disent : «ce sera alors un retour ruineux ! »
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 79:14: et voilà qu’ils seront sur la terre (ressuscités).
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 79:15: Le récit de Moïse t’est-il parvenu ?
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 79:16: Quand son Seigneur l’appela, dans Touwa, la vallée sanctifiée :
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 79:17: «Va vers Pharaon. Vraiment, il s’est rebellé !
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 79:19: et que je te guide vers ton Seigneur afin que tu Le craignes ? »
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 79:20: Il lui fit voir le très grand miracle.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 79:21: Mais il le qualifia de mensonge et désobéit;
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 79:22: Ensuite, il tourna le dos, s’en alla précipitamment,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 79:23: rassembla [les gens] et leur fit une proclamation,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 79:24: et dit : «C’est moi votre Seigneur, le très-Haut».
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 79:25: Alors Dieu le saisit de la punition exemplaire de l’au-delà et de celle d’ici-bas.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 79:26: Il y a certes là un sujet de réflexion pour celui qui craint.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 79:27: êtes-vous plus durs à créer ? ou le ciel, qu’Il a pourtant construit ?
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 79:28: Il a élevé bien haut sa voûte, puis l’a parfaitement ordonné;
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 79:29: Il a assombri sa nuit et fait luire son jour.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 79:30: Et quant à la terre, après cela, Il l’a étendue :
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 79:31: Il a fait sortir d’elle son eau et son pâturage,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 79:32: et quant aux montagnes, Il les a ancrées,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 79:33: pour votre jouissance, vous et vos bestiaux.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 79:34: Puis quand viendra le grand cataclysme,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 79:35: le jour où l’homme se rappellera à quoi il s’est efforcé,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 79:36: l’Enfer sera pleinement visible à celui qui regardera...
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 79:37: Quant à celui qui aura dépassé les limites
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 79:38: et aura préféré la vie présente,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 79:40: Et pour celui qui aura redouté de comparaître devant son Seigneur, et préservé son âme de la passion,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 79:41: le Paradis sera alors son refuge.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 79:42: Ils t’interrogent au sujet de l’Heure : «Quand va-t-elle jeter l’ancre»
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 79:43: Quelle [science] en as-tu pour le leur dire ?
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 79:44: Son terme n’est connu que de ton Seigneur.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 79:45: Tu n’es que l’avertisseur de celui qui la redoute.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 79:46: Le jour où ils la verront, il leur semblera n’avoir demeuré qu’un soir ou un matin.

null.verse 79:1: Bei den mit aller Macht (zur Wahrheit) Ziehenden,
null.verse 79:2: Und bei denen, die (ihre) Knoten fest binden,
null.verse 79:4: Dann bei den Voraneilenden und Übertreffenden,
null.verse 79:5: Dann bei den die Sachen Lenkenden.
null.verse 79:6: Am Tage, wenn die bebende (Erde) schwanken wird,
null.verse 79:7: (Und) ein zweites (Beben) drauf folgt,
null.verse 79:8: Herzen werden an jenem Tage zittern,
null.verse 79:9: Und ihre Augen werden niedergeschlagen sein.
null.verse 79:10: Sie sprechen: «Sollen wir wirklich in unseren früheren Zustand zurückgebracht werden?
null.verse 79:11: Wie! selbst wenn wir verwestes Gebein sind?»
null.verse 79:12: Sie sprechen: «Das wäre dann eine verlustbringende Wiederkehr.»
null.verse 79:13: Es wird nur ein einziger Schrei der Drohung sein
null.verse 79:14: Und siehe, sie werden sich (alle) zusammen im Freien scharen.
null.verse 79:15: Ist die Kunde von Moses zu dir gedrungen?
null.verse 79:16: Da sein Herr ihn im heiligen Tale Tuwá rief:
null.verse 79:17: «Geh hin zu Pharao, denn er ist widerspenstig,
null.verse 79:18: Und sprich: "Willst du dich nicht reinigen?
null.verse 79:19: Und ich werde dich zu deinem Herrn führen, auf daß du dich fürchtest."»
null.verse 79:20: So zeigte er ihm das große Zeichen,
null.verse 79:21: Er aber leugnete und blieb ungehorsam,
null.verse 79:22: Dann kehrte er den Rücken, um zu streiten.
null.verse 79:23: Er sammelte (sein Volk) und rief auf,
null.verse 79:24: Und sprach: «Ich bin euer höchster Herr.»
null.verse 79:25: Da erfaßte ihn Allah zur Strafe für jene und diese Welt.
null.verse 79:26: Hierin ist wahrlich eine Lehre für den, der fürchtet.
null.verse 79:27: Seid ihr denn schwerer zu erschaffen oder der Himmel, den Er gebaut?
null.verse 79:28: Er hat seine Höhe gehoben und dann ihn vollkommen gemacht.
null.verse 79:29: Und Er machte seine Nacht finster und ließ sein Tageslicht hervorgehen;
null.verse 79:30: Und währenddessen breitete Er die Erde aus.
null.verse 79:31: Und Er brachte ihr Wasser aus ihr hervor und ihr Weideland.
null.verse 79:32: Und die Berge, sie festigte Er -
null.verse 79:33: Als eine Versorgung für euch und für euer Vieh.
null.verse 79:34: Doch wenn das große Unheil kommt,
null.verse 79:35: Der Tag, da der Mensch sich (all) das ins Gedächtnis zurückrufen wird, was er erstrebt,
null.verse 79:36: Und die Hölle aufgedeckt wird für den, der sieht.
null.verse 79:37: Dann, was den angeht, der trotzt,
null.verse 79:38: Und der das Leben hienieden vorzieht,
null.verse 79:39: Brennendes Feuer soll fürwahr (seine) Wohnstatt sein.
null.verse 79:40: Was aber den anlangt, der das Stehen vor seinem Herrn fürchtet und die eigne Seele von niedrem Gelüst abhält,
null.verse 79:41: So wird der Garten sicherlich (seine) Wohnstatt sein.
null.verse 79:42: Sie fragen dich wegen der «Stunde»: «Wann kommt sie wohl?»
null.verse 79:43: Doch was hast du mit ihrer Verkündung zu schaffen?
null.verse 79:44: Das endgültige Wissen darum ist allein deinem Herrn (vorbehalten).
null.verse 79:45: Du bist nur ein Warner für den, der sie fürchtet.
null.verse 79:46: Am Tage, an dem sie sie schauen (da wird es sein), als hätten sie (in der Welt) nicht länger geweilt als einen Abend oder den Morgen darauf.
